forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 53. West southwest wind around 9 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

weather_report:
As the sun dips below the horizon, San Francisco finds itself nestled in a comforting embrace of partly cloudy skies. The temperature rests gently at a cool 53 degrees, a soft whisper of warmth carried by a west-southwest breeze of about 9 miles per hour. As dawn breaks over the city, the forecast promises a transition into a day graced with mostly sunny conditions, where the high will tiptoe around 66 degrees, settling to a more tempered 64 in the afternoon. Gusts from the southwest may offer the occasional playful dance, reaching 23 mph—a reminder of the city’s spirited winds.

While the iconic fog may not weave through the streets this morning, there are hints of the marine layer lingering just beyond the hills, a blanket that often decorates the Golden Gate with its ephemeral charm. The clarity of the day suggests that it will unfurl into moments of beauty, encouraging strolls along the waterfront or a visit to one of the many park benches, where one can sip coffee and watch life meander by. A light layering of clothing would be wise; a cardigan or light jacket might serve as a trusty companion when the breezes assert themselves. With such pleasant and inviting conditions, a leisurely morning walk or an afternoon spent exploring the neighborhoods seems befitting—creating a tranquil start to a quintessential San Francisco day.
